page.title: 13Fordham Woods, Fordham.
page.content: This wood is protected by the {Cambridgeshire and Ely Naturalist {Trust.}It is a wet-wood formed due to a below water-level site. The wood is being managed by volunteers to protect its special characteristics. Coppice work is in progress to develop a shrub habitat and ditches are being dredged to provide homes for frogs and dragon flies. Certain species of trees are encouraged like Alder and Willow whose rootsystems will resist wet condition Other trees are discouraged like the Sycamore which does not provide an ideal habitat for insects and which prevents the growth of other young shrubs and trees. The wood provides a home for roedeer, moorhens, and a variety of insects. The special plant species include Wild Hop and Water Violets. Birds found include Black Cap and Chiffchaff.
